content.webTitle: Deported woman returns to marry boyfriend

fields.headline: Deported woman returns to marry boyfriend
fields.bodyText: An asylum seeker deported with her family despite a passionate campaign to allow them to stay has returned to Britain to marry her boyfriend. Natasha Kachepa, 21, married Tom Sanderson in Weymouth, Dorset. But her mother, Verah, and her three siblings, who were removed to Malawi in August last year, heard the ceremony over a mobile phone after immigration officials prevented their return. "It was a lovely day," said Ralph Johnson, a family friend who gave Natasha away. "We just hope at some stage the government allows the others to visit and do normal family things."
